translated: Verses of the Elders
The Group of Sixes
The First Chapter🔽The Elder Jenta, the Son of the High Priest
I was intoxicated with the conceit of birth,
with wealth and sovereignty,
with my physical appearance and beauty,
intoxicated with conceit I went about.

analyzed: na a t tanoḥ samakam kañci
translated: I thought no one was my equal,
and I considered myself superior.
The fool was struck down by conceit,

analyzed: patthaddhaḥ ussitaddhajaḥ  mātaram pitaram ca api  aññe pi garu sammate
translated: arrogant, with his flag raised high.🔽I did not pay respect to anyone,
not even my mother or father or others held in high esteem,
struck down by conceit, without respect.
Seeing the foremost guide,
the best of charioteers,
shining like the sun,
at the head of the Saṅgha of monks,
I abandoned conceit and intoxication,
with a serene mind,
I paid respect with my head,
to the highest of all beings.
Excessive conceit and lack of conceit,
abandoned, well uprooted,
the conceit “I am,” cut off,
all forms of conceit destroyed.”🔽… the elder Jenta, the son of the high priest, was wise …
… Jenta the chief minister’s son …
